contract for Pasifika on Arbitrum Members enjoy reduced fees (0.5% instead of 1%) across all platform services Part of the 3-tier system: Guest (1% fee), Member (0.5% fee), Node Operator (0.25% fee) Includes the Pasifika Annual Event for profit-sharing: \"If we take care of our own, they will take care of us\" - 50% of Treasury profits are distributed equally to all members annually - Pasifika Financial Year runs from Dec 27 to Dec 24 (Boxing Day to Christmas Eve)","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"restoreMembership(address)":{"details":"Restore membership (admin only)","params":{"user":"Address to restore membership for"}},"revokeMembership(address)":{"details":"Revoke membership (admin only)","params":{"user":"Address to revoke membership from"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. returns._0: True if address is an active member

returns._0: Number of members who have claimed

getEligibleMembersCount().details: Get count of eligible active members

getMemberCount().details: Get total number of members (including inactive)

params.limit: Maximum number of members to return

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

hasClaimedProfit(address,uint256).details: Check if a member has claimed profit share for a specific year

returns._0: True if member has claimed for the specified year

initiateProfitSharing().details: Initiate the annual profit sharing event (admin only) This distributes 50% of the total profit from the treasury among members

isEligibleForProfitSharing(address,uint2.details: Check if a member is eligible for profit sharing

returns._0: Whether member is eligible for profit sharing

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

recordTransaction(address,uint256).details: Record a transaction for a member (called by PasifikaMoneyTransfer)

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setEligibilityRequirements(uint256,uint2.details: Set transaction requirements for profit sharing eligibility (admin only)
